JUDGES: Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Mihai Poalelungi;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza
TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the ORG by Mr M. Benedik , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

In DATE the applicant concluded a contract with CARDINAL persons by which he bought their CARDINAL ownership share in an immovable property . The remaining CARDINAL share was owned by CARDINAL individuals whose whereabouts were unknown .

On DATE the applicant lodged a civil action requesting the Bratislava II ORG to dissolve the joint ownership of the abovementioned property and to recognise him as the sole owner . The ORG found in the applicant ’s favour by a decision which became final on DATE .
On DATE an heir of CARDINAL of the CARDINAL co - owners , whose whereabouts had been unknown , requested the reopening of the proceedings .
On DATE ORG stayed the proceedings on the request for reopening pending the outcome of another action concerning the validity of the purchase contract of DATE ( see point C below ) .
On DATE ORG resumed the proceedings on the request for reopening and decided to reopen the original proceedings .

On DATE , on the applicant ’s petition ( podnet ) under LAW § CARDINAL of the LAW , ORG found that ORG had violated the applicant ’s right to a hearing without unjustified delay under LAW in the reopened proceedings . It found no delays in the period of the proceedings on the request for reopening .
On DATE ORG stayed the reopened proceedings pending the outcome of the applicant ’s request to reopen the proceedings on the validity of the DATE purchase contract ( see point C below ) .

On DATE , on the applicant ’s complaint ( sťažnosť ) under Article CARDINAL of the LAW , ORG found that ORG had violated the applicant ’s right to a hearing within a reasonable time and its constitutional equivalent in DATE ORG earlier judgment of DATE . ORG ordered ORG to proceed with the case and , having regard to its earlier finding of a violation of the constitutional equivalent of LAW , it awarded the applicant CARDINAL NORP korunas ( SKK ) ( the equivalent of MONEY ( ORG ) at that time ) as just satisfaction for nonpecuniary damage suffered .
The reopened proceedings were resumed in the context of ORG decision of DATE ( see point C below ) .

On DATE the proceedings were again stayed on the ground that ORG had lodged an extraordinary appeal on points of law in the proceedings concerning the request to reopen the proceedings on the validity of the DATE purchase contract .
After the proceedings had been resumed , ORG found against the applicant on DATE .
The applicant appealed and the proceedings are pending before the court of appeal .

This related set of proceedings concerning the validity of the purchase contract of DATE is the subject - matter of another application lodged by the applicant , which is pending before the ORG under number CARDINAL/CARDINAL .
On DATE an individual ( the heir of CARDINAL of the CARDINAL remaining coowners mentioned above ) requested ORG to declare the purchase contract of DATE null and void .
On DATE ORG granted the action and on DATE ORG upheld the judgment . After having been served on the applicant , the judgment became final on DATE .
On DATE the applicant requested that the proceedings be reopened . His request was dismissed , on appeal , on DATE . On DATE ORG declared the applicant ’s appeal on points of law inadmissible .
On DATE ORG dismissed the extraordinary appeal on points of law lodged by ORG .
On DATE , on the applicant ’s complaint under LAW , the ORG quashed the above ORG decision and remitted the case to the latter .

On DATE ORG again rejected the Prosecutor General ’s extraordinary appeal on points of law . On DATE the applicant challenged that decision before ORG . The constitutional proceedings are still pending .
